Reviews.Title: “good value - nice and very helpfull staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: Josef R
Reviews.Content: The Super8 Downtown LA is a real good place to stay if you are making a vaction through southern CA like we did. Good security, quiet and clean, good wifi. Breakfast is like in all motels - not too many choices. Best of all - the staff! A real gem is Darlene at the front desk! She was very helpfull, i didnÂ´t had such a nice lady on a frontdesk somewhere else before on motels/hotels. hanks to the nice man at the front desk as well. Sorry i forgot his name.. I definitley can recommend this motel and Super8 Motels at all !

Reviews.Title: “Hopeless location for city sightseeing, fairly cheap and spacious”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveller84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in Feb 2012. Was about a 28 minute walk to (I think) the nearest metro station, Civic Center, after which I resorted to taxis (around $7). Should have been more on the ball for this when looking at hotels. Reception staff friendly and helpful. Room - on the 1st floor. Fairly spacious and decent-sized bathroom but a little dingey and pokey. Good wifi connection. However this particular room was, as I discovered the next morning, underneath a mezzanine where people get to other rooms. The noise of a chambermaid's trolley (I assume that's what it was!) literally sounded like bombs were falling around the bedroom. Also - use every lock available to stop chambermaid's from enterting your room. I'd love to say that in this hotel "Do not disturb" signs are observed - but they're not. You'll get knocks on your door from 9am and they'll try and get in. With an overnight flight ahead of me, I'd planned to relax in the room until 12 but they clearly wanted me out much earlier than that.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and close to Dodgers stadium !”
Reviews.Author: Ronald_1971
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days at the Super 8 Downtown, which is at an excellent location if you want to visit the Dodgers baseball stadium. Also few pubs nearby. DonÂ´t understand why some people say this is a bad neighboorhood, walked the streets late and felt completely safe. Sufficient parking also available and hotel is a very convenient location to tour the City of Angels. Breakfast choice is limited, but acceptable. IÂ´ll be returning to LA this year and already booked this hotel again. Hope they add some choice to the breakfast by then ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, especially for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce F
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel that we stayed at. We checked in to the hotel around 10 PM and needed two rooms. The hotel staff was great and very friendly, it really seemed like they wanted our business. It was raining and they had signs out to keep people from slipping. They had a decent breakfast area with breakfast rolls, mini muffins, fruit, cereal, coffee, and juice. No view from the room, but still OK, especially for the price. Very close to the downtown area, but not in the high rise district.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if your passing thru..”
Reviews.Author: Michdek
Reviews.Content: For a Super 8, this hotel is pretty nice. There are microwaves, fridges, and coffee pots all included in the rate. There is also free parking, free internet, and free breakfast. The location is great and it is not too far from the Dodgers stadium. We walked over to chinatown and had a great dinner. The front desk staff is very freindly and accomadating. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable, but nothing around.”
Reviews.Author: childonmoon
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience with 'SUPER 8'. I had always had the impression that Super 8 was one class below Best Western. But I have to say that I was wrong. This hotel is perfect for a basic place. It has a nice and welcoming lobby with friendly staff. The room is clean and a good size. You will find a coffeemaker, fridge, microwave and TV with many channels. On each floor there is an ice machine and vending machines with drinks and snacks. Across the street there are some local/small supermarkets, but no big name grocery stores can be found in the immediate area. The price of the room is including internet and breakfast and parking which is a huge plus. The breakfast is very basic: Cereal, Milk, juice, apples bagels&creamcheese, coffee and tea. I enjoyed my stay at this place, mostly because of the room and nice atmosphere at the hotel. I have also stayed at the Dragon gate Best Western which is not too far from the Super 8 and has simular pricing. When I compare the 2 strictly on the room and hotel, I would say that both are equally nice. But the location of the Dragon Gate Best Western is better. Super 8 is on a bit of Sunset Blvd that doesn't have anything to offer. No restaurants, no shops and it is basically not close to anything. When you have a car, this is of course no problem. If you will not have a car. It is only a minor problem. Super 8 is about a 25 minute walk away from Union Station, or you can catch bus 2 or 4 (bus stop Sunset/Innes). The Bus stop is right next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly convenient for seeing the LA sights!”
Reviews.Author: evapor8
Reviews.Content: Hindsight is a wonderful thing, but sometimes it would be very handy! We booked this Super 8 for 2 nights as the price was reasonable (not cheap, but reasonable). The hotel was a good 30 mins bus/metro trip (through a pretty rough area) away from Hollywood. Whilst the stock photo of the building makes it look ok, it was pretty tatty inside. Beds were comfortable enough. People manning the front desk were a mixture of quite helpful and downright rude. If I needed a cheap(ish) place to stop for a night whilst driving, I might consider staying here, but there must be plenty of better places as a base to see the (limited) sights of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Manager needs to be trained in Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: J T
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and it was terrible - The walls in this hotel are paper thin and you can hear everything that goes on in the rooms around you â€“ even someone going to toilet!! On the both nights the whole hotel was kept awake by females fighting and screaming obscenities at each other in one of the rooms, this went on for hours, when I complaint to the front desk as Iâ€™m sure others would have also done, I was told I needed to contact the hotel manager, which I found to be another drama, it ended up taking me 4 days to eventually get hold of her, when I explained what had happened I was told by her quote â€œwhat do you want me to do these people paid for a room the same as you didâ€� I was shocked by her comments and told her so then I was told quote â€œwhy did you bother staying the both nights if it was that badâ€� the only reason we did as it was near the end of our trip and this hotel has a no refund policy and our finances were low â€“ I would strongly recommend that if you are travelling with a family and want some sleep of a night that you give this hotel a miss it is very very noisy and the hotel Manager seems to want to encourage this behaviour !!

Reviews.Title: “About right for the price”
Reviews.Author: Notts_Today
Reviews.Content: Positives - good sized room, clean, helpful staff, breakfast included(not huge but starts you off), free safe parking, no hidden costs, good regular bus route to Dowtown and West Hollywood(they do stop often though), safe area by all accounts we walked out late in the evening with no trouble, a good mexican place down the road to eat. Negatives - the room wasn't that noisy it kept me awake but being first on the row in a motel is always going to attract more noise than the end room and there was one occassion people congregating to smoke on floor 2. Maybe this was the smoking area I dont know. No safety box in rooms but we found all USA motels not to have them later on our trip. Overall - You get what you pay for - this served us just fine for 3 nights and we got a cheap deal. I wouldnt stay a here for a week but would stay again for a few nights. We did find getting back late at night a bit of an hassle on the bus......regular yes and all night but it seem to take ages, Sunset Blvd is very long!!!!...however the local wacks on the bus entertained.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: CarloLivorno
Reviews.Content: Just one night stop for attending an event at Staples Center. The neighborhood is a bit scaring but actually we did'nt notice anything wrong. Our room window was a window facing nowhere (a wall), but clean and decent. Breakfast poor but at last, for our goal (attending an event at night) the location was good and no matter how the breakfast was...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Mayoress
Reviews.Content: This seemed to be the only hotel available when I was booking. It wasn't my first choice, but there weren't any other options. We only needed the room overnight so I wasn't too fussed. Unfortunately the motel was booked out so we were only offered a smoking room which was pretty bad. Clean, but the smell was overwhelming. If you're worried about noise, book a room towards the back of the motel. Decent value, good location. Just would have been a bit more bearable in a non-smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Towel Scam”
Reviews.Author: NotSoPickyBut
Reviews.Content: Prior to staying here I read the review dated Sept, 2010 titled Liars! Hidden Fees! and thought it wasn't real UNTIL I noticed a separate charge added AFTER I left. I called the hotel and they are accusing me of stealing their towels. I'm sorry but why would I want to own towels of this quality. Think about it, this hotel is a good value because everything is low budget INCLUDING THE TOWELS. ..they are a step above towels I use to dry off my car. If you do stay here I would recommend to definitely change your room if you get one in the front ...very noisy and upon checking out bring your towels down to the desk and have them sign their letterhead that you have left the towels. In fairness, it is a decent value and the free breakfast is not bad but scams like this are inexcusable. I visit USC once a month and unfortunately I will never stay at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal!”
Reviews.Author: abbydab
Reviews.Content: Well located on Sunset Blvd near Silver Lake, the place was easy to find. Parking was free and the breakfast was abundant. The room and hotel were spotless and the staff very friendly. The hotel maintains additional security by resetting all the door locks daily. The rooms are large and the bathroom had adequate space for two guests. I will stay there again on my next visit to LA..

Reviews.Title: “Clean, kind, well-situated”
Reviews.Author: Kucher88
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our 19-month old for the first time, and were very nervous about it. All for naught! The hotel was great - very large room, at our request it was non-smoking, and situated in the quietest part of the building. Very clean, newly-renovated, quiet. A mini-fridge and a coffee-maker adds to the comfort, as one can buy groceries or fast-food in stores near-by, there is a laundromat across the street, and it's on a public transportation line. It is also close to two pharmacies, and a great park (Echo Park). A little further down Sunset blvd there is an interesting strip lined with cafes, diners, restaurants and curio shops. The staff is very friendly and courteous. Great for a budget traveler, with or without family... We'll definitely stay there if we go back to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms in the front of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: slowlion
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the good reviews I read - its location, cleanliness and friendly staff. I found all of this to be true - it was a five minute drive to the Garment District, Bonaventure and Walt Disney Concert Hall. Our room was clean, the beds comfortable, the staff friendly, no frills for a decent price for downtown LA. However, we were given a room in the front of the hotel which is on a busy noisy intersection. Trucks and motorcycles all night long. I wore earplugs and could still hear the traffic noise. I would stay here again, but ask for a room toward the back of the hotel. You will still hear some noise, but not like you would staying in those front rooms.

Reviews.Title: “LIARS!!!! AND HIDDEN FEE'S”
Reviews.Author: societyinchaos
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week and first of all the service was horriable no one knew what was going on and our room didnt have hot water the bed was itchy and the worst was they said i stole a towel now tell me why i would want a itchy dirty towel and couldnt dry anything so i am taking advise from towlie "don't forget to bring a towel" because they will slap you will fees galore STAY AWAY or pay with cash only!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, decent location”
Reviews.Author: kellcc
Reviews.Content: I visited LA for a music festival and was looking for a nice hotel while still meeting my budget. This particular Super 8 was perfect. The staff was very, very friendly and helpful, the room was clean and in nice condition and it was also in close proximity to everything I needed (echo park, state historic park, etc). The continential breakfast wasn't extraordinary or anything, but I did not expect it to be. It had all you would need: coffee, juices, cereal, danishes. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is just staying a couple of nights and not looking for a luxury resort to stay at. I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best motel in usa”
Reviews.Author: MarkoT4
Reviews.Content: nice experience. clean room,nice location. everything is good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: clipsalcruiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel in April. We are from Australia so had no idea of the different parts of LA and because the address of this hotel is Sunset Boulevard we thought it would be central to everything (we found out that Sunset Boulevard goes for miles!). When we got there we discovered that it is a predominantly Mexican neighbourhood which was an eye opener for us. We felt like outsiders when going into the shops, laundromattes and cafes, however this was no-ones fault and I guess in a way was good for us to see the different people that make up America. When in our hotel room we felt safe, however there is no safe in the room so we carried our valuables with us. We walked down the road at dusk one night and didnt feel unsafe, not sure if i would go on my own though. The room was clean but the window looks onto the next doors roof so dont expect a view. The receptionist was friendly and helped us book a tour. I would suggest if you are a first timer to LA that this hotel doesnt give you the best side of the city but a local or out of towner would probably be more at home here. In all we had a good stay here with no problems. The continental breakfast was sufficient but dont be a minute late because they clear it away right on closing.

Reviews.Title: “New paint, old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulofsf
Reviews.Content: When I'm in LA, I usually stay at a 4-star downtown hotel courtesy of Hotwire. This time, though, the Hotwire option was out of my budget, so I thought I'd give the Super 8 a shot. Bad idea. The hotel isn't terrible--my room was clean, and the staff was nice--but it's a far cry from the Super 8 Culver City where I had stayed the night before. The bed was amazingly hard, and the pillows had that delightful bag-of-cottonballs feeling. My *favorite* part was the shower, which continuously alternated from hot to cold no matter how much I fiddled with the controls. Next time, I will be going back to Hotwire, even if it means an extra $50 in hotel/parking/internet fees.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Service & Breakfast for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: 1978thetrav
Reviews.Content: I live in Orange County and frequently spend nights in LA for concerts, shows, dining or to visit friends. I chose this motel because it is close to a friend's house we visited, and don't like to make the drive home after a drink or two. This motel provides: - decent clean rooms - 4 star hotel customer service - a great continental breakfast - affordable rates for a young traveler - a great central location for any traveler with a rental car. Just a short drive to everything! The surrounding neighborhood is run-down, but the over all location is a great alternative to a hostel or an overpriced 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Karla is the BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: kch33082
Reviews.Content: Karla was the person at the front desk when I checked in and out. She was so friendly and helpful and wonderful! It is so hard to find people with GOOD customer service skills these days, let alone GREAT ones!!! I will stay at this hotel again and recommend it to my friends solely based on the awesome experience provided to us by Karla! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, and Fantastic Base of L.A”
Reviews.Author: soniacard
Reviews.Content: Well after reading some reviews on this website about this hotel i decided to booked a room here. I would like just to said that the reception staff was very helpful, Darlene was the one that take care of us. And she did a great job because my friend and i we did not have a car and she helped us how to used the buses and she gave us maps too. I think she does a great job.Thaks Darlene i hope we see you on my next trip to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Great service late at night: Super 8 Motel, downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: DuabiPitcher
Reviews.Content: Simply read the comments I sent to this guy's boss! Just a quick note to advise you of the excellent help and service I received from Mr. Manuel Martinez whilst I stayed at your motel, 31st July - 1st August. I arrived really tired at 11:30 pm. I needed a phone card and directions as I had meetings at 6am the next day. Mr. Martinez was very helpful with directions, shop opening hours and their locations and ensured my stay was problem free. He even opened up the breakfast area early so I could have a coffee. Again, many thanks. Rgds, Ian Withers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Next to Dodger Stadium”
Reviews.Author: SoCal_Consultant
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd or 4th stay at this Super 8. We like it for its proximity to Dodger Stadium. The hotel staff is friendly and the rooms are clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ivonnep
Reviews.Content: well, i was in los angeles for business and i diced to stayed in this super 8. I woul like to recommend this hote because, they have a great service, all the employees are really friendly and really helpfully. Speacially when i checked in it was a girl that she looks young but she has a lot of knowledge with the customers. I would come back to this hotel for sure......

Reviews.Title: “good location but a bit of a dive”
Reviews.Author: loumcd
Reviews.Content: a bit of a grubby dive this - cheap for l.a. but did not feel clean. also noisy. wi-fi did not work in our room. in good location though for bars and restaurants in echo park.

Reviews.Title: “a great little motel”
Reviews.Author: ronnidonni
Reviews.Content: We stayed here specifically to see a Dodger game and were pleasantly surprised. The continental breakfast is great, with juices, fresh milk and cereal, partries and of course decent coffee. There was a coffee maker, microwave and fridge in the room. The location is great, it took less than 10 minutes to walk to Dodger Stadium. The neighborhood is ok, very quiet in the morning and all of the shop owners we met were very friendly. Parking is somewhat tight and we came back the first night to find all the motel parking full. However, they have a couple of reserved spots for this reason and we were able to park in the lot. Seems they have trouble with non-guests parking in the lot when the Dodgers are in town. The management said they have the unauthorized cars towed, but we weren't worried about that since they had a spot for us. The GM is a very good guy, big Dodger fan and I enjoyed talking with him about Dodger history. He grew up in the neighborhood and is very knowledgeble and helpful about the area. Over all a very good experience at this Super Eight and I'll be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend for budget conscience”
Reviews.Author: PamAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on arrival in LA from Australia and would recomend this hotel for the budget conscience traveller. The rooms are clean and comfortable although not large and definately not extravegant. Some care would need to be taken if walking around late at night but early evening wasn't a problem. The continental breakfast at the hotel has a large variety to choose from and was fresh and enjoyable. Would definately recommend the mexican restaurant across the road for breakfast, lunch or dinner (but be aware that they aren't open at all on Mondays). Although we didn't speak mexican the shop keepers and restaurant staff in the area all went out of their way to understand what we wanted. As this was our first experience with the mexican way or life we found it a great all round experience to start our holiday in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “wrong choice!”
Reviews.Author: wondRR
Reviews.Content: first time to l.a. arrived bob hope, taxi drivers had to ask where! the drive asked, why are we staying at this hotel? In the middle of nowhere we understood! after exhaustingly telephone calls and on line (in the lobby) we found another closer to where we wanted to be. a couple bus rides and the rail to Hollywood and western we found the other one at sunset, a block and a half away. unable to straighten things out, i had to purchase another stay. yea! double! since it wasn't in advance. no refund, not even credit for the same hotel chain! rip- off?

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: michegato
Reviews.Content: stayed 1 night after dodger game , room was very clean and newly redone. Noise wasn't bad at all. close to dodger stadium. not bad

Reviews.Title: “Please Stay Away...Look elsewhere - Double Charged”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: DOUBLE CHARGED...and was lied to by management. I booked this hotel "On-line" for my wife and myself Friday, Aug. 12, 2005 for one night. The hotel is nothing better than 1-1/2 stars. We reserved a non-smoking room through their official site, but received a room that had ash trays. Do ash trays equal non-smoking? The room had a odd smell, but we did not complain to front desk...as it was only one night. The neighborhood is not a place to take your kids, nor yourself. There are not any restaurants, grocery stores, within walking distance. We had pizza delivered to our room from Dominoes. During the night there were many loud noises and people yelling once in a while. NO PARKING...We ordered in because we didn't want to lose our parking spot. There are only about 20 parking spots for the 3 floors of motel rooms. People started parking in the two handicap spots as the side streets were full. The area just did not feel safe. We booked this hotel a few weeks in advance to go to the Dodgers and Mets game on Saturday Aug. 13, 2005 then planned to drive back to our residence in central California after the game...HOWEVER... THREE WEEKS LATER...I received my credit card bill and was charged $82.02 for Aug. 12, 2005...AND then another $82.02 for August 14, 2005. We had only booked for one night and only stayed for one night. ...I called the hotel to get reimbursed for the extra 82.02. The first time I called, I spoke with the night worker (Rafael, I think)...he looked up the paperwork and told me that I called to add a day to my stay. I explained to him that I reserved for one night and it was on-line only. He proceeded to tell me that I was wrong. I even have the receipt from the one night with ONLY Friday checked off (beyond the fact that I never called). Anyway, he told me to call back the next day to speak to the manager. I spoke to the manager (Adrianna) and I received the same exact response. She even said I spoke to her about extending the stay (I never made any calls to the hotel or Super 8). I got really frustrated at this point. She said she would have to talk to the owners about the situation. What is the point of a manager if they can't take care of simple errors like this one. ...I have also called the main Super 8 phone number and all they said they can do at this point is submit a complaint which goes to the same hotel (not much sense in that is there?...even when I explained the hotel has not cooperated). Super 8 billing said that I would have to wait at least 7 days before they could butt into the situation (that I may add was not my fault or error, but instead the hotels). I am going to call the hotel back today to see what the owners will say about the situation. I will update my review when the 82.02 is credited back to my account. ...If they cannot cooperate and solve a simple problem like this, I will submit my complaint to the District Attorney and copy it to the Better Business Bureau and get it solved myself. Who knows how many other people they have tried to DOUBLE CHARGE. Next time I will stay at La Quinta or Baymont Inn. I am done with Super 8 after I get my 82.02 back in my wallet. Respectfully, David
